page.title: 09MINER IN SEAFIELD, KIRKCALDY
page.content: Although opened 20 years ago Seafield Colliery now represents the major single source of employment in Kirkcaldy and surrounding districts. The mine currently employs 1160 miners together with a further 80 people employed in managerial, secreterial, catering and nursing capacities. Four shifts are operated in each 24-hour period. The miner descends in the lift cage which carries 100 men at a time. He will then continue his underground journey by train, which will take him 85-90% of the way, the remainder being done on foot. Each man spends 7.25 hours underground, of which 1\-2 hours is spent travelling to and from the coal face.
